qas.question: Which male private school in Boston, USA has Eton formed a relationship with?
Where do Hennessy Scholars typically reside?
In which year was the Hennessy Scholarship founded?
What is the G20 School's Group?

answers.text: a collection of college preparatory boarding schools from around the world

qas.question: In what year was Robert College founded in Turkey?
In what year did F. Washington Jarvis retire from Roxbury Latin at their headmaster?
In what year did Singapore's Raffles Institution open their doors?
In what year was the G20 Schools Group established?
Who was Switzerland's International School of Geneva's headmaster in 2005?

context: Eton College has links with some private schools in India today, maintained from the days of the British Raj, such as The Doon School and Mayo College. Eton College is also a member of the G20 Schools Group, <a3_0>a collection of college preparatory boarding schools from around the world<a3_0/>, including Turkey's Robert College, the United States' Phillips Academy and Phillips Exeter Academy, Australia's Scotch College, Melbourne Grammar School and Launceston Church Grammar School, Singapore's Raffles Institution, and Switzerland's International School of Geneva. Eton has recently fostered[when?] a relationship with the <a0_0>Roxbury Latin School<a0_0/>, a traditional all-boys private school in Boston, USA. Former Eton headmaster and provost Sir <b8_0>Eric Anderson<b8_0/> shares a close friendship with Roxbury Latin Headmaster emeritus F. Washington Jarvis; Anderson has visited Roxbury Latin on numerous occasions, while Jarvis briefly taught theology at Eton after retiring from his headmaster post at Roxbury Latin. The headmasters' close friendship spawned the Hennessy Scholarship, an annual prize established in <a2_0><b4_0><b5_0><b6_0><b7_0>2005<b7_0/><b6_0/><b5_0/><b4_0/><a2_0/> and awarded to a graduating RL senior for a year of study at Eton. Hennessy Scholars generally reside in <a1_0>Wotton house<a1_0/>.
